intro: Microstephanus cernuus, commonly known as the drooping stephanus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters. The plant features delicate, branching stems with small, hairy leaves that are often arranged in opposite pairs. Its flowers are clustered in loose inflorescences and are usually pink or purple in color. Microstephanus cernuus thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
